title: The Missing README: A Guide for the New Software Engineer
author: Chris Riccomini and Dmitriy Ryaboy
review: I borrowed this book from an eLibrary and read it from Overdrive. I bought a physical copy of this book afterwards for future quick reference. It was a good one.

title: Head First Design Patterns
author: Eric Freeman
review:
I was bored on the train when I encountered this book. I've learned many patterns from this book in an interesting way. Definitely recommend this one.
See my notes

title: Soft Skills: The Software Developer's Life Manual
author: John Sonmez
review: This is the first book that made me realized that software developer is a job. To be richer, the book teaches you how to use your programming skills to the fullest such as creating a blog or make instructing videos on how to program. Show the world what you know. Then it also briefly mention about investing on houses and stock.
